alert.note: Alert for Guernsey; Muskingum; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 3:48PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN GUERNSEY... SOUTHEASTERN MUSKINGUM AND WEST CENTRAL NOBLE COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 348 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms 9 miles southwest of New Concord, or 10 miles southeast of Zanesville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Caldwell, Philo, Cumberland, Belle Valley, Chandlersville, Ruraldale, High Hill, Duncan Falls, Blue Rock State Park, and Wolf Run State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 165 and 166. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 25 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central Ohio.
